definition: he or him/(used for either sex when the sex is unknown or unimportant)/(used before sb's name for emphasis)/(used as a meaningless mock object)/other/another
owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)
surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy

sentences.english: Altruism is another big draw to the company garden.
sentences.chinese: 利他主義是公司菜園的另一大收穫。

sentences.english: And then we'll move towards altruism, towards non kin.
sentences.chinese: 然後我會講對非親人的利他主義。

sentences.english: It actually can help us explain altruism.
sentences.chinese: 這的確可幫我們解釋利他主義。

sentences.english: There are also indicators that altruism has biological roots.
sentences.chinese: 可是也有關於利他主義具有生物學根源的證據。

sentences.english: But he acknowledges it is not pure altruism.
sentences.chinese: 但他承認，這並非基於純粹的利他主義。

sentences.english: Altruists may be more content or fulfilled than selfish people.
sentences.chinese: 利他主義者可能比自私者更加滿足或有成就感。

sentences.english: So, it seems, altruism is simply self-interest of a subtle kind.
sentences.chinese: 所以，貌似利他主義不過是一種微妙的利已主義罷了。

sentences.english: We'd get about as much altruism from an ant colony.
sentences.chinese: 我們能從一羣螞蟻身上得到同樣的利他主義。

sentences.english: Contemporary discussions of altruism quickly turn to evolutionary explanations.
sentences.chinese: 當代有關利他主義的討論迅速轉向生物進化的解釋。
